metadata.name: Song Intent Examples
metadata.description: Complete examples of the three-phase song intent schema

triumphant_hope.title: Triumphant Hope Example
triumphant_hope.description: A song about surviving and celebrating without guilt

song_root.core_event: Surviving something I didn't think I could survive.
song_root.core_resistance: Not wanting to seem like I'm gloating or dismissing the struggle.
song_root.core_transformation: I want to feel expansive and grateful.

song_intent.imagery_texture: Open/Vast, like looking out over an ocean

song_technical_constraints.rule_breaking_justification: To make the hope feel earned and slightly bittersweet.

expected_output.progression: D - A - Bm - G with bVI (Bb) at emotional peak
expected_output.groove: Laid back neo-soul pocket, slight swing
expected_output.production: Wide stereo field, open highs, room to breathe

defiance_liberation.title: Defiance and Liberation Example
defiance_liberation.description: Choosing your own path over expectations

song_root.core_event: The moment I realized I had to choose my own path over my family's expectations.
song_root.core_resistance: Fear of sounding selfish or too abrasive; wanting to soften the truth.
song_root.core_longing: To feel completely free and fully justified in my independence.
song_root.core_stakes: Personal (my future identity is at stake)
song_root.core_transformation: I want to feel stable and defiant when the song finishes.

song_intent.imagery_texture: A sudden, blinding light after being in the dark.

song_technical_constraints.rule_breaking_justification: To create an unsettling feeling of being perpetually 'off-kilter' before the 'Sudden Shift' in the structure.

expected_output.progression: Em - C - G - D with Cmaj (Dorian IV) for hope
expected_output.groove: Driving, relentless, but slightly displaced for tension
expected_output.arrangement: Constrained verses, explosive shift to liberation
expected_output.production: Industrial textures, then sudden clarity at shift

grief_misdirection.title: Grief with Misdirection Example
grief_misdirection.description: A song where every line sounds like falling in love until the reveal

song_root.core_event: Finding someone I loved after they chose to leave.
song_root.core_resistance: Fear of making it about me; not wanting to exploit the loss.
song_root.core_longing: To process this without feeling like I'm seeking attention for trauma.
song_root.core_transformation: I want to feel like the grief has been witnessed, held, and released into something beautiful.

song_technical_constraints.rule_breaking_justification: The iv chord (Bbm) makes the hope feel earned and slightly bittersweet, never letting the listener fully settle.

system_directive.output_target: Verse chord progression with misdirection structure

expected_output.progression: F - C - Am - Dm in verses, F - C - Bbm - F at reveal
expected_output.arrangement: Love song structure until final verse reveals truth
expected_output.production: Intimate, room sound, pitch imperfections preserved

song_root.core_event: The moment reality stopped feeling real.
song_root.core_resistance: Fear of sounding crazy or being misunderstood.
song_root.core_longing: To feel connected to my own experience again.
song_root.core_transformation: I want to feel present, even if that means feeling pain.

song_technical_constraints.rule_breaking_justification: Vocals buried in texture mirrors the feeling of being disconnected from your own voice and experience.

expected_output.progression: Amaj7 - G - D - A (bVII creates floating sensation)
expected_output.production: Heavy reverb, vocals behind instruments, blurred transients

anger_catharsis.title: Anger and Catharsis Example
anger_catharsis.description: Releasing rage in a controlled explosion

song_root.core_event: Being betrayed by someone I trusted completely.
song_root.core_resistance: Fear of being 'too much' or scaring people.
song_root.core_longing: To express the full depth of this rage and be done with it.
song_root.core_transformation: I want to feel emptied out and at peace when this is over.

song_intent.imagery_texture: Sharp edges, breaking glass, red vision

song_technical_constraints.rule_breaking_justification: Power chord parallel motion creates the wall of sound that anger needs - no delicacy, pure force.

expected_output.progression: Dm5 - Bb5 - C5 - A5 (pure parallel power chords)
expected_output.groove: Relentless, pushing forward, no laid back feel
expected_output.arrangement: Build and build, explosive release, then sudden quiet
expected_output.production: Distortion, clipping at peaks, extreme dynamics

HARMONY_AvoidTonicResolution.example_use: End on IV chord for unresolved yearning

HARMONY_ParallelMotion.example_use: Power chord progressions for wall of sound

HARMONY_ModalInterchange.example_use: Bbm (iv) in F major for earned sadness

RHYTHM_ConstantDisplacement.example_use: Shift all hits late to create perpetual tension

RHYTHM_TempoFluctuation.example_use: Gradual BPM drift for organic breathing

PRODUCTION_PitchImperfection.example_use: No pitch correction for emotional truth
